attributes.action: Amend handgun commandments that illegalize pistol firearms.
attributes.background: I want licensed gun owners to able own pistols as I find it strange how the government allows for the use of shotguns and hunting rifles, however, neglects the use of a smaller, less powerful, and  considerably cheaper firearm to purchase in comparison to a shotgun that can be very expensive

attributes.action: Classify the laser pointer as an 'offensive weapon'
attributes.background: Following laser attacks on hundreds of civil aircraft, including Virgin Atlantic flight VS025 which was forced to return to Heathrow Airport, we call upon the government to classify the laser pointer as an offensive weapon. The mis-use of these devices put hundreds of lives at risk on a daily basis.

attributes.action: Make video recording of hearings in Courts and Employment Tribunals mandatory.
attributes.background: At present, litigants-in-person and certain groups receive hostile and unfair treatment in Courts and Tribunals. Employment tribunals do not record proceedings. Voice recordings in Courts are edited before being released. The system makes perjury possible and perversity in decisions unchallengeable.

attributes.action: Invest in a single nuclear deterrent with USA, France & Europe and stop Trident
attributes.background: A nuclear deterrent is an insurance policy or safety net you hope will never be used. The world just needs one safety net. We should join the Americans, French and Europeans and invest in a common nuclear deterrent for the democratic world saving billions and not build our own exclusive safety net.
attributes.additional_details:
This arises from an idea in the book Diagonal Lengths: Rethinking our world, (page 121) of a common body taking on the role to defend against Nuclear aggression, thereby saving individual countries from each having to invest in and develop their own nuclear deterrents.

With Trident due to cost £30 Bn, why don't we invest £10Bn into a common shared project with the US, France and rest of Europe to build a single nuclear deterrent and use the £20 Bn we save on other uses -NHS, Education, Research

attributes.action: Make our Road Tax and Fuel Tax get spent on the roads and not other things!
attributes.background:
Our roads are getting much worse and action needs to be taken. They are becoming dangerous and causing damage to our vehicles.
We pay tax on our fuel and we pay road tax which should be used to replace and repair the roads but isn't all spent on the roads which is appalling. 
LETS TAKE ACTION NOW

attributes.action: Conduct a national referendum to solve London’s airport capacity stalemate
attributes.background:
This petition suggests a nationwide referendum with the following options: 
No new Runways
New Runway at LHR
New Runway at Gatwick
New Runways at both Gatwick and Heathrow.
London airport capacity has been a recurrent and politically sensitive issue.
attributes.additional_details: This has resulted in a perpetuating pattern of indecision and enquiries. Air travel is recognised as being a driver of jobs and economic growth. The 2008 Greater Manchester Transport referendums should be used as a referendum template. The result of this democratic process should lead to a swift policy announcement, using public opinion to influence this decision as a way of decreasing the political bias that has historically surrounded the issue.

attributes.action: To make Motorway driving part of the Cat B ( Car ) test.
attributes.background:
Recently, a new law has been passed to penalise drivers who do not move back to the inside lane after an overtake etc. 
This is due drivers not fully understanding how to drive on the Motorway. This in turn cause others to make rash decisions out of frustration and potentially causing an accident.

attributes.action: Scrap Trident and use the money to find a cure for cancer .
attributes.background: Why spend millions on a weapon we don't need, we can't use it anyway. Why not spend money saving lives.

attributes.action: To allow the wife of veteran of ex-soldier Andrew McLaughlin, to live in the UK.
attributes.background: Andrew McLaughlin has an American wife and a 2-year old daughter and they have been denied entry into the UK because of the Government's strict laws on the rights of non-EU spouses.
attributes.additional_details: Andrew is a former soldier with the Grenadier Guards who served in Afghanistan from March to September 2012. He is from Warwickshire and is a lifelong Aston Villa fan. He married his American wife Wanda in December 2011 and they have a 2-year old daughter who have been refused entry to the UK because of his low income.

attributes.action: Debate triggering Art.50 and withdrawing from the EU is in the national interest
attributes.background: The referendum result was decided on a narrow percentage majority and already the consequences have been significant. It is the duty of members of the House to consider the national interest and regional and age profile disparity in the results suggests that this is not a settled matter.

attributes.action: We will not tolerate public acts of discrimination
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Govt. to increase punitive measures in response to public acts of aggressive, racial and xenophobic discrimination by 50% for a period of 1 year following the EU Referendum. We believe this will send the clear message that the People of Britain do not tolerate racism.
attributes.additional_details: In the wake of the EU referendum, the risk that racism and bigotry will show itself as an accepted part of our society is higher than ever. By signing this petition, you are calling on our Government to take official steps to show that we are not a racist, bigoted nation and will punish those who seek to do harm to another person because of their culture, religion, country of origin or ethnicity and those who seek to alienate  people along these lines during this political upheaval.

attributes.action: Discuss a National Coalition government after the EU referendum result
attributes.background: Britain exiting the EU is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. Unity is required and there are concerns of a rise in too far to the right politics.
attributes.additional_details: Exiting Europe is the biggest challenge to face the UK since World War Two. A rise in racism and contempt has been reported by immigrants and by people of a minority ethnicity and I feel the British people need reassurances that the goverment won't be led too far right. A Tory lead coalition government with Labour and SNP should be discussed. I feel the coalition will offer stability and offer the best negotiations for the British people when exiting the EU.

attributes.action: Open age restrictions for Lifetime ISA
attributes.background:
Allow to open and contribute until 50 years old
Currently only available to 18 to 40 years of age
Pays 25% bonus pa on £4k

attributes.action: Free statin and other long term and lifelong medication
attributes.background: Not all long term medication is free of prescription charges.
attributes.additional_details:
Unless you are receiving benefit, statins and many other long term drugs are subject to a £8.40 charge; per medication. There are many people that are employed but struggle to afford this. These prescription charges represent nothing more than an unfair, stealth tax. 
If the general population were forced to pay an additional £8.40 in tax, every month for life, there would be public uproar! 
This is immoral, fundamentally wrong and needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: Make Continuous Glucose Monitors available on the NHS for Type 1 Diabetics
attributes.background:
CGMs are a considered less invasive than Blood Glucose Meters. They also help users to maintain target blood glucose levels & limit the risk of hypos.

Access to this technology is limited on the NHS. However, they can help to avoid night-time severe hypos, & severe hypos cost the NHS £13m a year.
attributes.additional_details:
CGMs work 24 hours a day and can include alarms to indicate when glucose levels are too high. Research suggests they can help to reduce haemoglobin A1c without increasing the risk of a hypo. 

The initial cost of the hardware for a continuous glucose monitor can vary from around £1,000 to £2,500. In addition to this, running costs are estimated at £40-£60 per 5-7 days. Access to this important technology should not be based upon whether or not the patient is able to afford it.

attributes.action: A second referendum if UK job losses exceed 12,000 after initiating Article 50.
attributes.background: The referendum campaigns were based on projections that were largely distrusted. A "pain threshold" of 12,000 job losses would be the equivalent of three "Port Talbot Steelworks", the latter creating considerable public out-cry when the potential 4000 job losses were announced in March 2016.
attributes.additional_details: If corporations announce expected job cuts that they will implement if the Article 50 process is initiated, then there will be some threshold over which the electorate and politicians on either side of the debate should be allowed to reconsider their referendum position. Announcements of UK job losses on Friday 24th June already include JP Morgan (4,000), HSBC and Morgan Stanley with the first already matching Port Talbot. A second referendum can help the United Kingdom avoid such job losses.

attributes.action: Introduce pre-referendum as an entry requirement before future major referendums
attributes.background: Before important future referendum i.e. like should UK be in the EU or not? A pre-referendum is issued first  to ensure that eligible voters understand what they are voting for. The results of pre-referendum should be used as weighting to set the criteria that main referendum is considered passed.
attributes.additional_details: It is obvious from personal stories from friends and families and other stories trending on the internet that a significant number of people voted when they did not know what they were really voting for and also were using as a protest rather than considering and forming balanced opinion based on informed arguments for yes or no.

attributes.action: Disband the office of the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: Since 1651 we the subjects United Kingdom and the commonwealth have only had a hand full of successful Prime  Ministers, I believe that we should empower our Monarchy with the full powers invested in a head of state

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on rejoining the EU every tenth year, starting June 2026.
attributes.background:
Young people voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU (about 75% of those aged 18-24).

To give them hope, we're asking that in June 2026, and in every tenth June afterwards so long as Britain is outside the EU, a referendum be held on the question "Should Britain now apply to rejoin the EU?".

attributes.action: Open The United Kingdom's borders for free trade with everyone in the world.
attributes.background: Further to the EU Referendum which voted for The United Kingdom to leave the European Union, I propose that we open our borders for the free movement of goods to and from anywhere in the world.

attributes.action: Deputy Prime minister post alongside Primeminister & one of them must be a woman
attributes.background: According to 2011 census the UK population was estimated 31 million men and 32.2 million women. By a women in such a key post by law will bring equality and fairness in politics and businesses - women think, work and decide differently - having women's contribution will enhance government polices.
attributes.additional_details: Out of 650 MPs there are 191 women although their representation is improving, they are still often a long way from getting to the highest posts. Studies at Stanford US and University of Chicago have found that districts served by female legislators are at a distinct advantage over those represented by men. Women are actually more inclined towards more modern leadership, which is collaborative problem-solving, enabling, consultative, and not just trying to assert a kind of hierarchical power.

attributes.action: Provide a way to account for children's opinion on issues affecting their future
attributes.background: 14 million under 18s live in the UK and aren't able to vote. According to Unicef they have the right for their views to be heard and respected. When important debates are taking place, directly affecting their future, we propose that their opinions should be officially collated by Government.
attributes.additional_details:
.UN Convention on the Rights of the Child, Article 12 (respect for the views of the child) and Article 13 (freedom of expression).
.Improving the Spiritual, Moral, Social and Cultural (SMSC) development of pupils: Departmental advice for independent schools, academies and free schools (DfE November 2013, p5)
.Section 78 of the Education Act 2002
.UNICEF- Promoting Children's Participation in Democratic Decision Making (Gerison Lansdown, UNICEF Innocenti Research Centre, ISBN: 88-85401-73-2)

attributes.action: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education
attributes.background: Trans issues should be taught as part of Personal, Social and Health Education. Also, Gender-variant young people should get sufficient support at school. Schools need to understand their responsibilities under the Equality Act 2010 and must ensure all staff receive training.
attributes.additional_details: The House of Commons Women and Equalities Committee published a report in January 2016 with regards to Transgender Equality. Within this report it was established that more needs to be done to ensure that gender-variant young people receive support in school. the Equality and Human Rights Commission stated that research shows that 91% of trans boys and 66% of trans girls experience harassment or bullying at school, leading to depression, isolation and the desire to leave education.

attributes.action: Allow 15,16 and 17 year olds to vote in a second referendum.
attributes.background: The generation of people who were not allowed to vote will be the ones who are most affected by the change. Therefore they should be allowed a say in their future by having a vote in a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of 18-24 year olds voted remain, this shows that the young people of our population want to stay and should be given a chance to make this happen.

attributes.action: After the EU vote, we call for the dismantlement of the unelected House of Lords
attributes.background: As the UK has voted to "take back control" from the EU from what was claimed to be a democratically unaccountable Brussels, we propose that the UK should follow this line of reasoning and "take back control" from the un-elected House of Lords by dissolving it.
attributes.additional_details:
The British Parliament contains one of the world's largest decision making bodies called the House of Lords. The peers of this House are un-elected. 

In the EU, the British people could appoint European members of Parliament. But the elected European Parliament is also complemented by un-elected Institutions. The British confirmed they do not want to be apart of this. As the House of Lords is in the British Parliament, the British people have the capability to remove this un-elected House.

attributes.action: Those who couldn't vote in the EU referendum (flooding and travel) to vote!
attributes.background: Many people were affected by the floods and polling stations so were unable to vote. Reopen voting to allow these people to vote.

attributes.action: Referendum for all Inner London boroughs to leave the United Kingdom
attributes.background: All Inner London Boroughs voted unanimously to remain within the European Union with over 60% voting remain. The decision by the rest of the UK to leave the EU means there should be a referendum for Inner London boroughs to leave the UK and become an independent country within the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
London provides 22% of UK GDP.
If the capital was an independent country, its £534,821 million GDP would make it the 18th largest economy in the world, just below the Netherlands. 
Outer London boroughs such as Sutton and Barking & Dagenham voted Leave therefore the independence referendum should be for Inner London boroughs.

attributes.action: Lower the Income Requirement for Spouse/Family Visas to UK from non EU Countries
attributes.background: The current income requirement for British citizens to bring their non-EU spouses to the UK is £18,600. According to the BBC, 50% of British Citizens do not earn enough to meet the new requirements. Britons earning minimum wage should have the right to a family. by basic human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
The High Courts suggested £13,000 ,above National Minimum Wage.Which, is being appealed by the Home Office as too low. Members of the EU with non-EU spouses aren't subjected to the same requirement. British citizens should not be punished for who they want to marry. 
The HS, Theresa May, said 'these current laws openly discriminate against the poor'.
Propose lowering the income requirement so that citizens working full-time(40 hours)on a minimum wage salary can be with their Spouses.

attributes.action: All licenced bars and clubs should have a breathalyser to prevent drink driving
attributes.background: This petition is to ask the government to make all licenced bars and clubs which serve alcohol to have breathalysers at hand for patrons to use if in control of a vehicle. This would minimise the risks associated with driving over the drink drive limit and would inturn reduce drink drive fatalities.

attributes.action: A referendum to Vote Scotland out of the U.K.
attributes.background: Scotland had their Referendum to be independent. The SNP want to Remain in the EU against the will of English and Welsh voters. Therefore I believe England, Wales and Northern Ireland should get the chance to have their Referendum to vote Scotland out of the U.K.

attributes.action: Enforce all secondary schools to teach Drama, Art and Music at key stage three.
attributes.background:
The majority of jobs require creativity, and although you need natural talent, if these subjects are not taught, the youth will never have the freedom to think creatively and explore a world other than academia. 
Without creativity where will the next Branson, Ant & Dec, or Kelly Hoppen come from?

attributes.action: Ensure that in future, qualifying persons are automatically registered to vote.
attributes.background:
To vote in a UK election a person must be "registered to vote" and also: 18 or over, be a British citizen, a qualifying Commonwealth citizen or a citizen of the Republic of Ireland.

The requirement to register should be dropped so that those meeting criteria are automatically able to vote.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/electoral-register

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on roads for vans or put up speed road sign for vans.
attributes.background: When driving a transit type van the national speed limit  is lower for vans than cars. Speed signs are displayed for cars but not vans. Most van drivers also drive a car so it can be confusing when there are no speed respeater signs for vans. Van technology has improved making them safer.

attributes.action: Care homes to be required by law to provide Mario Kart gaming for residents.
attributes.background: This petition was started by a medical student who recently attended an Elderly Medicine placement in Derbyshire. In many Local Authority owned care homes, residents would be sat passively in front of the lounge television screen. Residents may enjoy a competitive, interactive activity instead.
attributes.additional_details: "When groups of generally healthy medical patients aged 50 and over were instructed to play a video game that increased in difficulty and complexity with each new level, researchers at the University of Iowa found that they gained years of cognitive processing improvement after one year of play." Lynn, Kecia (2015). More Proof That Elderly People Should Play More Video Games. Big Think. http://bigthink.com/ideafeed/more-proof-that-elderly-people-should-play-more-video-games

attributes.action: Ban residential bonfires during Summer.
attributes.background:
We don't get too many sunny days in the UK, but when we do you know someone locally will be having a bonfire! 

I want to petition the government to stop residential bonfires during the summer months from when the clocks go forward until the clocks go back.

attributes.action: Ban leashing dogs by their collar, in favour of front-chest harnesses
attributes.background:
Being leashed by the neck puts pressure and damage on:

- the trachea (windpipe)
- the spinal cord 
- the vertebral discs, 
- the oesophagus (gullet)

Harnesses offer better safety and comfort, alleviating pressure on the neck and also allowing the owner to better pull the dog from harms way.
attributes.additional_details: "I have observed the relationships between the neck injuries and health of dogs, and learned that if the flow of energy in the neck is interrupted or restricted, a whole array of problems may arise, including lameness, skin issues, allergies, lung and heart problems, digestive issues, ear and eye conditions and thyroid gland dysfunctions. I also suspect that the patients who have severe energy flow congestion in the neck area have higher cancer rates" - Dr. Peter Dobias, Holistic Veterinarian.

attributes.action: Introduce retrospective legislation offering protection to company pension funds
attributes.background: Philip Green purchased BHS in 2000. Since then he has reportedly extracted £580M from the company, driving it to bankruptcy. Meanwhile there is a £571M shortfall in the pension fund affecting thousands of workers. This is a morally reprehensible situation that should be rectified.

attributes.action: Receiving Carers Allowance should not affect other benefits or taxes
attributes.background: People who receive Carers Allowance should not have to pay extra tax or have their other benefits cut. People receiving a state pension must also be able to claim Carers Allowance while looking after a loved one. Mandy Bayliffe tried to change things in her short life so now we must.
attributes.additional_details: Carers Allowance should be tax-free, like PIP, and shouldn’t affect any other benefits that carers may receive. I am 67 years old, in receipt of a State Pension, which I paid for through 40 years of work. Yet I cannot claim Carers Allowance because the Government does not allow you to claim both. This means men and women who can claim their State Pensions are excluded. These same people are more often than not by their loved ones sides 24/7 yet receive no recompense for it either.

attributes.action: Impose legislation to allow online cancellation of services bought online
attributes.background: Many services such as insurance, credit record services and music streaming can be bought online, 24 hours a day. However in most cases customers are required to telephone between certain hours on certain days & speak to a salesperson who will try to convince the customer to stay.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is limiting choice & costing the public money when they are forced to continue paying for a service they no longer require because companies make the process deliberately difficult to protect their profit.

We request the government impose a legal requirement on all services that provide on-line signup to also provide an easy on-line cancellation process with the same availability without unreasonable limitations.

attributes.action: Stop councils forcing homeless tenants to stay past a section 21
attributes.background:
Local housing authorities are forcing private tenants to stay after the end date of a section 21, and making them wait until bailiff evictions. The tenant is responsible for the court and bailiff costs.
If the tenant does not stay, they are deemed intentionally homeless and refused help.
attributes.additional_details: Both local councils and shelter England advice the tenant to stay after the end of the section 21 date. Why should the tenant be liable for cost when following the councils guidance? Why should landlords have to take tenants to court to get their properties back.? Why are councils using a form of blackmail to get tenants to do what they want?

attributes.action: Ensure that children's safeguarding be monitored by specific named professionals
attributes.background: The Woods LSCB review states that challenge by the LSCB is vital, but the government response to the review gives responsibility to public bodies with no named professional to offer challenge or monitor change. Revised LSCB terms of reference could provide this and safeguard vulnerable children.
attributes.additional_details: The best performing LSCBs are those with strong chairs that provide robust challenge and monitor improvement. The government response to this review is to remove the statutory strength that permits this challenge. This government has a duty to ensure that its duties are wholly taken over by a named role/team within or independent of these agencies and safeguard vulnerable children, a team already existent in current LSCBs that could be strengthened by revised terms of reference.

attributes.action: Stop children from being punished for their hair at school.
attributes.background: I believe that all children in the UK should be allowed to have a hairstyle that they like, rather than being force to have hair that is considered 'decent' by the school. Children should not be punished for having a hair style that expresses their personality, but schools still have the right to.
attributes.additional_details: My son got placed in isolation for going into school with short hair a few months ago. I can understand their stance on no makeup or nail polish (not that this would apply to my child) due to it able to be changed before and after school. However, someone cannot change the length or colour of their hair. Whilst my child broke the school rules without good reason, a friend of his has a mum that was diagnosed with cancer. So, his friend shaved his head to support her but got punished.

attributes.action: Ban being able to own, and have a cockerel in an urban area, they are loud.
attributes.background: I have an inconsiderate neighbour, who will not put a collar on their cockerel to reduce the noise of the crow, the cockerel cannot help it, that's the way God made it, but us humans need to keep the animals in the country and out of urban area.

attributes.action: Make throwing bread and crumbs to birds a non littering offence.
attributes.background: I threw a bit of bread on the floor for the birds to eat, and I got an on the spot fine for doing this, even after I went picked it up and put it in the bin. The council workers waited in the car until after the "offence" happened, they were also only wearing all black with no high vis jackets on.

attributes.action: Make solar renewable energy a government-led initiative
attributes.background: While it has been often argued that the United Kingdom is a leader in the field of renewable energy, this has primarily been accomplished by the actions of private British businesses and not the actions of the government. It is most certainly time for the government to take its place in the sun.
attributes.additional_details: It is our goal, as it should be the goal of every person both of and on these islands and elsewhere on this planet, to protect it for future generations. There is no doubt in the minds of scientists that a future including humans must be a future of renewable and clean energy. We therefore recommend that the government require all of its properties, and those owned by its representatives of the people of both the upper and lower chambers, to, within a period of five years, possess solar panels.

attributes.action: Create degrees and masters level apprenticeships for art and design disciplines.
attributes.background: Governments changes to creative education could contribute to the ‘collapse’ of an industry worth billions to the UK economy. Apprenticeships in Higher Education should be available as these cover creative industry skills, requirements and occupational necessities. This increases many opportunities.
attributes.additional_details: Academic research by Birmingham City University looked at changes to design practice, policy and education over the last decade and demonstrated that the subject was being increasingly marginalised. The report, titled Beyond Discipline: Design Practice and Design Education in the 21st Century, which was published by the University’s Strategic Creativity Research Lab, found that design was being devalued by Government despite the industry accounting for 3.5 per cent of the country’s GDP.

attributes.action: Apply diplomatic pressure to both Norway and Japan to cease killing Whales.
attributes.background: Norway kills around 500 Minke Whales annually and Japan continues to defy International agreements citing scientific research as an excuse to hunt and kill whales. The most efficient killing methods leave about 20% of whales alive after the first strike, allowing untold agony and lingering death.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Make childhood vaccinations a legal requirement for state-school education
attributes.background: Un-vaccinated children pose a potentially serious risk to the health of other children - particularly those for whom vaccines are less effective or who are medically unable to be vaccinated. Where the failure to vaccinate has no medical basis, other children should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent years have seen a rise in outbreaks of preventable diseases, which has been at least partially attributed to an increase in parents electing not to have their children vaccinated. These include smallpox (which had been all but eradicated by vaccination), and measles. 
Children are at particular risk, due to the way they play very closely together, and their less developed immune systems.
In Australia, it is already a requirement for receipt of state welfare.

attributes.action: Pedestrian crossings by all schools
attributes.background: 2incidents have happened at my daughters school recently, I have wrote to local council to ask about a pedestrian crossing and their response was until there is a fatality, the answer is no! This IS DISGRACEFUL. I petition for crossings for all parents to get their children to school safely.
